questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A user works from a remote location and has a LAN connection and a mobile internet connection. Each connection is provided by a different internet service provider.
The user can make and receive calls by using the LAN connection. The user cannot make or receive calls by using the mobile connection.
You need to determine the cause of the issue.
Solution: Use the Skype for Business Network Assessment tool to determine of the user has access to all Microsoft Teams URLs and IPs.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/SkypeForBusiness/optimizing-your-network/media-quality-and-network-connectivity-performance

Selected Answer: A
Skype for Business Network Assessment Tool - Under the "Details" network connectivity. 

Verify network and network elements between the test location and the Microsoft Network are correctly configured to enable communication to the IP addresses and ports needed for Microsoft Teams calls.

https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=53885
On the other hand, it does not say whether user is using smart phone :) fun fun))
I dont think Skype Network assessment tool can help you to troubleshoot mobile/cellular network.

questions.question_text:
You are a Microsoft Teams administrator for a ExamTopics company. The company uses active calling plans and dynamic emergency calling.
One of the company's offices is moving to a new physical location.
You need to use the Teams admin center to update the emergency address for the new office location.
What should you do?

choices.D: From Network and Locations, delete the current address and create a new location with the new address.
choices.A: From Emergency Addresses, edit the current address.
choices.B: From Emergency Addresses, delete the current address and create a new location with the new address.
choices.C: From Network and Locations, edit the current address.

discussion.content: B correct, because you can not edit validated emergency addresses, so they have to be deleted, new created and validated.

Selected Answer: B
Correct
correct~

choices.A: The source port for audio is above 50,000.
choices.B: The source port range for audio is too narrow.
choices.D: The TLS traffic is being limited.
choices.C: The UDP traffic is being limited.

discussion.content: In the Network Trace you can see that the Dest Port is 443 https. Teams Media Traffic will use UDP by default and will only fall back to TCP/TLS 443 if UDP is not allowed.

Selected Answer: C
Correct

comments.content: Got this question also in my MS-700 exam in december 2021 was unsure if that really is a MS-700 question

discussion.content: MS-700 question, was on exam now in december 2021

questions.question_text:
Users report call delay during Microsoft Teams audio conferences.
You run a network trace from a user's device during an audio conference. You review the following trace results:
//IMG//

You need to identify the cause of delay.
What is the cause?

choices.C: Ensure that the SBC certificate is from a trusted Certificate Authority (CA).
choices.B: Replace the partner-hosted SBC with a self-deployed SBC.
choices.D: Modify the FQDN in the SIP profile to match the SBC certificate.
choices.A: Ensure that the Secure Real-Time Transport Protocol (SRTP) is enabled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Correct
SRTP packages wont be sent before SIP options has been received. 
Microsoft has no opinion whether you self-deploy or use a partner-hosted (carriers) and eventhough the partner may have made a configuration error it would seem less likely compared to doing it yourself since they configure Teams Direct Routing on a regular basis. 
The link provided clearly states that option C and D is the correct choice.
Correct~
Answer is correct. Those are 2 possible reasons.

questions.question_text:
You are managing a Microsoft Teams environment for a company. You are setting up direct routing on a partner-hosted session border controller (SBC).
The SIP proxy does not receive SIP options from the SBC.
You need to resolve the issue.
What are two possible ways to achieve the goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Purchase and assign an international calling plan to the associated resource account.
choices.C: Assign a phone system license to the associated resource account.
choices.D: Configure external sharing settings from Azure Active Directory.

questions.question_text:
A company has Microsoft 365 E5 licenses. The company uses phone numbers that are provided by Microsoft.
An auto attendant is not able to forward calls to external numbers.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
When transferring calls to an external phone number, the resource account performing the transfer (that is, the one associated with the auto attendant or call queue) must have a Microsoft 365 Phone System Virtual User license and one of the following assigned:
- A Calling Plan license and a phone number assigned
An Operator Connect phone number assigned
An online voice routing policy (phone number assignment is optional when using Direct Routing)

comments.content: So the answers should be A - number is from MS (Calling Plan).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Phone system license cannot be assigned to a resource account
Answer should be B

Selected Answer: B
Guys come on here. This is basic stuff. An AA requires a phone system AND a calling plan to make external calls. The answer is B because the question specifically states an issue with external calling. External calling requires a calling plan. It doesn't have to be international, but that is the only option.

If a resource account doesn't have a phone system license assigned then a number cannot be assigned to the account. The option will be greyed out.

The auto attendant already receiving calls and processing it (AA already assigned a virtual license), for AA to forward calls to external number it needs the following as per the link posted:

"When using a resource account for calling line ID purposes in call queues or when an auto attendant or call queue is transferring calls to an external phone number, the resource account must have a Phone System Virtual User license and one of the following assigned:

A Calling Plan license and a phone number assigned
An Operator Connect phone number assigned
An online voice routing policy (phone number assignment is optional when using Direct Routing)"
Correct~

Answer C should be correct. The acc routing the number should have Phone System capability through the Virtual User license assigned. A calling plan ist not required for the acc as mentioned here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-add-on-licensing/virtual-user#change-an-existing-resource-account-to-use-a-microsoft-365-phone-system--virtual-user-license

comments.content: A resource account with a Microsoft Calling Plan number, need a Microsoft Calling Plan license and as well a Phone System Virtual User license

discussion.content: I think in cases when customers use Microsoft numbers the Resource Account does need a Calling Plan license to be able to transfer calls to ext parties . Not necessarily international thought
